page.title: 14TRANSPORT
page.content: Transportation is by bicycle,motor bicycle,car,van,lorry,taxis,buses, train,tractors & aircraft for pleasure , crop spraying,& passenger in transit(flight paths over head).Much passes through this area on the A20 to & from the channel ports.Huge Jumbulances frequent this route.They are large double caravan type vehicles which convey chronically sick people to the shrine at Lourdes. Load weights of HGV vehicles are frequently checked on this route. Buses service Westwell four days a week and Hothfield every day.Commuters use their own cars & taxis to get to Ashford station.There are a fair proportion of multi-car families.Horse transportation is mainly for pleasure.
